required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Study of Patients Who Were Treated With Fondaparinux Pre-, Peri- and/or Postpartum for Prophylaxis or Treatment of Venous Thromboembolism
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospektive Studie zu Patientinnen, Die pränatal, Perinatal Oder Postnatal Prophylaktisch Oder Therapeutisch Mit Fondaparinux Behandelt Wurden

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this retrospective study is to gather information about how fondaparinux is used pre-, peri- and/or postpartum for both the prophylaxis and treatment of venous thromboembolism (VTE) in order to fill an information gap concerning the off-label use of fondaparinux during pregnancy.

detailed_description.textblock:
During pregnancy there is a generally enhanced risk to develop venous thromboembolism (VTE). Although such events are rare they may lead to serious risks for the mothers´ and children´s health. Compared with non-pregnant women, pregnant women have an about five-fold risk to develop VTE.
Due to their characteristic spectrum of side effects and the generally long duration of exposure in pregnancy the preferred anticoagulants may produce potentially dangerous side effects, as bleedings, heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT), allergic reactions, osteoporosis, or congenital anomalies.
Today, low-molecular weight heparins (LMWH) are the preferred agents for anticoagulation in pregnancy. Compared with unfractioned heparins (UFH) LMWHs have the advantages of a lower bleeding risk, a lower rate of allergic reactions and HIT, a more predictable response and a longer half-life that makes dosing more convenient (od or bid).
Still, there is a considerable proportion of pregnancies where heparin intolerance (allergic reactions or HIT) that make it inevitable to change to another anticoagulant.
On the one hand, fondaparinux has repeatedly been reported successful in the VTE prophylaxis of pregnancies where allergic reactions on heparins, or heparinoids, had occurred. Additionally, a considerable amount of oral reports have reached GSK about an additional number of successful cases in the past.
On the other hand, we have no systematic and overall view about how many pregnancies have already been treated for which reasons, and how successful they were. Due to an increase of certain risk factors, as obesity or the growing age of mothers at childbirth with the associated need for anticoagulation, we expect an increased number of cases where alternative anticoagulation to heparins may be needed.
There are a number of potential advantages of fondaparinux over heparins, such as a once daily application, no dose adjustment needed to body weight and no monitoring of thrombocytes, a lower potential for causing intolerance reactions and no risk for HIT.
The objective of this retrospective study is to gather information about how fondaparinux is used pre-, peri- and/or postpartum for both the prophylaxis and treatment of VTE in order to fill an information gap concerning the off-label use of fondaparinux during pregnancy.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Receiving Fondaparinux in the Indicated Therapy Intervals
primary_outcome.description: The prenatal interval is defined as the interval of time until 3 days before birth. The perinatal interval is defined as the interval of time from 2 days before birth to one day after birth. The postnatal interval is defined as the interval of time beginning 2 days after birth.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Indicated Reason for Change to Fondaparinux
primary_outcome.description: It was possible for a participant to have changed to fondaparinux for multiple reasons.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Administered the Indicated Dose of Fondaparinux Per Day

primary_outcome.description: The prenatal interval is defined as the interval of time until 3 days before birth.
The postnatal interval is defined as the interval of time beginning 2 days after birth.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants for Whom Fondaparinux Administration Was Interrupted for Birth
Number of Hours Before Birth That the Last Fondaparinux Dose Was Administered
Number of Hours After Birth at Which Fondaparinux Administration Was Restarted
Number of Participants With the Indicated Reason for the End of Fondaparinux Administration
primary_outcome.description: It is possible that a participant stopped receiving Fondaparinux for multiple reasons.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Indicated Outcome of Pregnancy by Type of Birth
Number of Participants With the Indicated Type of Conception/Fertilization
Number of Participants Who Delivered a Single Child Versus Twins
Mean APGAR Score at 1, 5, and 10 Minutes After Birth
primary_outcome.description: APGAR is a test performed by a doctor, midwife, or nurse at 1 and 5 minutes after birth. The 1-minute score determines how well the baby tolerated the birthing process; the 5-minute score assesses how well the newborn is adapting to the new environment. The health care provider examines the baby's breathing effort, heart rate, muscle tone, reflexes, and skin color. Each category is scored with 0 (worst score), 1, or 2 (best score), depending on the observed condition. The rating is based on a total score of 1-10, with 10 suggesting the healthiest infant.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Newborns Who Had a "Healthy" Postnatal Classification
primary_outcome.description: A "healthy" documentation was based on the investigators' individual assessment.
No formal definition for abnormalities was predetermined; documentation was based on the investigators' individual assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Hospitalized Because of Thromboembolic Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Thromboembolic treatment is a defined as prophylaxis for an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of All Hospitalizations Under UFH, LMWH, and Fondaparinux Administration
Duration of Hospitalizations Before, During, and After Fondaparinux Administration
Number of Participants With Complications Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: A complication is defined as any thromoemolism, bleeding, skin change, HIT, amputation, or other complication (as indicated by investigator).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Thromboembolisms Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Any sign of thromboembolism as indicated by investigator was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Bleedings Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: No formal definition for bleeding was predetermined; documentation was based on the investigators' individual assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Skin Changes Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: No formal definition for skin change was predetermined; documentation was based on the investigators' individual assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration From Start of UFH/LMWH Therapy to Skin Change
secondary_outcome.description: No formal definition for skin change was predetermined; documentation was based on the investigators' individual assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Exhibited Observed Skin Changes and Also Had Erythema Associated With the Skin Changes Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Erythema is defined as inflammation of the skin, associated with reddening, and is a frequent side effect of heparins.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Exhibited Observed Skin Changes and Also Had Skin Necrosis Associated With the Skin Changes Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Skin necrosis is defined as the dying off of skin area because of allergic reaction. Skin necrosis is a severe side effect of heparins.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Heparin-induced Thrombocytopenia (HIT II) Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: HIT II is characterized as a sudden decrease of thrombocyte count because of allergic response on heparin/platelet factor 4 (PF-4) complexes and is a severe and potentially fatal side effect of heparins. Usually, HIT occurs between Day 5 and Day 14 of exposure to UFH or LMWH.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration From Start of UFH/LMWH Therapy to HIT
Number of Participants With and Without Complications Under Fondaparinux Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: A complication is defined as any thromoemolism, bleeding, skin change, HIT, amputation, death, or other complication (as indicated by investigator).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Thromboembolisms Under Fondaparinux Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Any sign of thromboembolism as indicated by investigator was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Bleedings Under Fondaparinux Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: No formal definition for bleeding was predetermined; documentation was based on the investigators' individual assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Skin Changes Under Fondaparinux Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: No formal definition for skin change was predetermined; documentation was based on the investigators' individual assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Heparin-induced Thrombocytopenia (HIT II) Under Fondaparinux Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: The participant with HIT II was pretreated with LMWH; however, the serious adverse event of HIT II was documented after the participant switched to Fondaparinux treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration From Start of Fondaparinux Therapy to HIT
secondary_outcome.description: For the 1 participant who developed HIT after receiving Fondaparinux, the number of days from start of therapy to HIT is presented.

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women who received a prophylaxis against venous thromboembolism because of an elevated thromboembolic risk and who were therefore treated in a haemostaseological centre.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who were treated with fondaparinux pre-, peri- and/or postpartum for more than 7 days for VTE prophylaxis or treatment, especially those with a history of abortion, and/or stillbirth, VTE, severe fetal and maternal complications during pregnancy, severe inherited or acquired thrombophilias, long-term anticoagulation (e. g. patients with mechanical heart valves) and/or intolerance to heparins or heparinoids or heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who were treated with fondaparinux for less than 7 days
- Patient who were treated with fondaparinux only postpartum

group.title: Fondaparinux
group.description: Retrospective systematic documentation of female participants treated with Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum. The potential prophylactic dose was 1.5 or 2.5 milligrams (mg); the standard prophylactic dose was 2.5 mg. The potential therapeutic dose was 5, 7.5, or 10 mg. Higher than recommended doses could have been administered off label.

group.title: Fondaparinux
group.description: Retrospective systematic documentation of female participants treated with Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum. The potential prophylactic dose was 1.5 or 2.5 milligrams (mg); the standard prophylactic dose was 2.5 mg. The potential therapeutic dose was 5, 7.5, or 10 mg. Higher than recommended doses could have been administered off label.

measure.title: Age
Gender
Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: BMI is calculated as body weight in kilograms (kg) divided by body height in meters squared (m^2)

measure.title: Number of participants with the indicated anamnestic thromboembolisms
measure.description: Known anamnestic (experienced in the past) arterial and venous thromboembolisms, important dispositional risk factors, are reported. A thromboembolism is a clot in the blood that forms and blocks a blood vessel.

measure.title: Number of participants with known thrombophilia
measure.description: Thrombophilic defects, important dispositional risk factors, are reported. It is possible for a participant to have multiple responses. Thrombophilia is a genetic disorder of blood coagulation that increases the risk of thrombosis.

measure.title: Number of participants with the indicated risk factors for venous thromboembolism
measure.description: It is possible for a participant to have more than one of the indicated risk factors.

measure.title: Number of participants with the indicated number of former pregnancies
Number of participants with the indicated type of former birth
measure.description: It is possible for a participant to have more than one type of former birth. It is possible for a participant to have multiple responses.

measure.title: Number of participants who indicated that they did or did not have former abortions
measure.description: Participants were asked to respond “Yes” or “No” to the question: “Did you have former abortions.” Only those participants who reported a former pregnancy responded to this question.

measure.title: Number of participants with the indicated number of former abortions
measure.description: Data were collected from only those participants who gave a response of “Yes” to the question of “Did you have former abortions.”

measure.title: Number of participants undergoing either prophylaxis or therapy
measure.description: The number of participants receiving either antithrombotic prophylaxis (designed and used to prevent a disease from occurring) or therapy of acute venous thromboembolism was measured. It is possible for a participant to have multiple responses.

measure.title: Number of participants receiving the indicated type of prophylactic treatment
measure.description: A prophylactic treatment is one that is designed and used to prevent a disease from occurring. Prophylaxis for thromboembolic risk is treatment for dispositional thromboembolic risk factors. It is possible for one participant to undergo multiple types of prophylactic treatment.

measure.title: Number of participants receiving therapeutic treatment for the given indications
measure.description: It is possible for one participant to undergo multiple types of therapeutic treatment for multiple indications.

measure.title: Number of participants receiving thromboembolic prophylaxis for the given indications
measure.description: It is possible for one participant to undergo multiple types of treatment for multiple indications. VTE, venous thromboembolis.

measure.title: Number of participants with thrombophilia accompanied by venous thromboembolism (VTE) in anamnesis
measure.description: Thrombophilia is a genetic disorder of blood coagulation that increases the risk of thrombosis.

measure.title: Number of participants who did and did not receive UFH
measure.description: Unfractionated heparin (UFH) is an anticoagulant.

measure.title: Duration of UFH administration
Number of participants with the indicated reason for the end of UFH administration
measure.description: It is possible for one participant to have multiple responses.

measure.title: Number of participants receiving the indicated type of low-molecular-weight heparin (LMWH)
measure.description: It is possible for one participant to have multiple responses.

measure.title: Duration of LMWH administration
Number of participants with the indicated reason for the end of LMWH administration
measure.description: It is possible for one participant to have multiple responses.

outcome.description: The prenatal interval is defined as the interval of time until 3 days before birth. The perinatal interval is defined as the interval of time from 2 days before birth to one day after birth. The postnatal interval is defined as the interval of time beginning 2 days after birth.
outcome.population: Pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010

outcome.title: Mean Weight of Newborn
outcome.population: Newborns of pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010. A total of 124 newborns were born to 120 women; 4 women bore twins. n=63 newborns with non-missing data.

group.title: Fondaparinux
group.description: Retrospective systematic documentation of female patients treated with Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum. The potential prophylactic dose was 1.5 or 2.5 milligrams (mg); the standard prophylactic dose was 2.5 mg. The potential therapeutic dose was 5, 7.5, or 10 mg. Higher than recommended doses could have been administered off label. Data were collected from newborns delivered by participants who received Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum.

outcome.title: Mean APGAR Score at 1, 5, and 10 Minutes After Birth
outcome.description: APGAR is a test performed by a doctor, midwife, or nurse at 1 and 5 minutes after birth. The 1-minute score determines how well the baby tolerated the birthing process; the 5-minute score assesses how well the newborn is adapting to the new environment. The health care provider examines the baby's breathing effort, heart rate, muscle tone, reflexes, and skin color. Each category is scored with 0 (worst score), 1, or 2 (best score), depending on the observed condition. The rating is based on a total score of 1-10, with 10 suggesting the healthiest infant.
outcome.population: Newborns of pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010. A total of 124 newborns were born to 120 women; 4 women bore twins. n=26 (1 min) or n=27 (5 and 10 min) newborns with non-missing data.

group.title: Fondaparinux
group.description: Retrospective systematic documentation of female patients treated with Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum. The potential prophylactic dose was 1.5 or 2.5 milligrams (mg); the standard prophylactic dose was 2.5 mg. The potential therapeutic dose was 5, 7.5, or 10 mg. Higher than recommended doses could have been administered off label. Data were collected from newborns delivered by participants who received Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum.

measure.title: Mean APGAR Score at 1, 5, and 10 Minutes After Birth
measure.description: APGAR is a test performed by a doctor, midwife, or nurse at 1 and 5 minutes after birth. The 1-minute score determines how well the baby tolerated the birthing process; the 5-minute score assesses how well the newborn is adapting to the new environment. The health care provider examines the baby's breathing effort, heart rate, muscle tone, reflexes, and skin color. Each category is scored with 0 (worst score), 1, or 2 (best score), depending on the observed condition. The rating is based on a total score of 1-10, with 10 suggesting the healthiest infant.
measure.population: Newborns of pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010. A total of 124 newborns were born to 120 women; 4 women bore twins. n=26 (1 min) or n=27 (5 and 10 min) newborns with non-missing data.

outcome.title: Number of Newborns Who Had a “Healthy” Postnatal Classification
outcome.description: A “healthy” documentation was based on the investigators’ individual assessment.
outcome.population: Newborns of pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010. A total of 124 newborns were born to 120 women; 4 women bore twins.

group.title: Fondaparinux
group.description: Retrospective systematic documentation of female patients treated with Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum. The potential prophylactic dose was 1.5 or 2.5 milligrams (mg); the standard prophylactic dose was 2.5 mg. The potential therapeutic dose was 5, 7.5, or 10 mg. Higher than recommended doses could have been administered off label. Data were collected from newborns delivered by participants who received Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum.

measure.title: Number of Newborns Who Had a “Healthy” Postnatal Classification
measure.description: A “healthy” documentation was based on the investigators’ individual assessment.
measure.population: Newborns of pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010. A total of 124 newborns were born to 120 women; 4 women bore twins.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Exhibited Observed Skin Changes and Also Had Erythema Associated With the Skin Changes Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
outcome.description: Erythema is defined as inflammation of the skin, associated with reddening, and is a frequent side effect of heparins.
outcome.population: Pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010. Only participants exhibiting skin changes are included in this analysis.

group.title: Fondaparinux
group.description: Retrospective systematic documentation of female patients treated with Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum. The potential prophylactic dose was 1.5 or 2.5 milligrams (mg); the standard prophylactic dose was 2.5 mg. The potential therapeutic dose was 5, 7.5, or 10 mg. Higher than recommended doses could have been administered off label.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Exhibited Observed Skin Changes and Also Had Erythema Associated With the Skin Changes Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
measure.description: Erythema is defined as inflammation of the skin, associated with reddening, and is a frequent side effect of heparins.
measure.population: Pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010. Only participants exhibiting skin changes are included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Exhibited Observed Skin Changes and Also Had Skin Necrosis Associated With the Skin Changes Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
outcome.description: Skin necrosis is defined as the dying off of skin area because of allergic reaction. Skin necrosis is a severe side effect of heparins.
outcome.population: Pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010. Only participants exhibiting skin changes are included in this analysis.

group.title: Fondaparinux
group.description: Retrospective systematic documentation of female patients treated with Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum. The potential prophylactic dose was 1.5 or 2.5 milligrams (mg); the standard prophylactic dose was 2.5 mg. The potential therapeutic dose was 5, 7.5, or 10 mg. Higher than recommended doses could have been administered off label.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Exhibited Observed Skin Changes and Also Had Skin Necrosis Associated With the Skin Changes Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
measure.description: Skin necrosis is defined as the dying off of skin area because of allergic reaction. Skin necrosis is a severe side effect of heparins.
measure.population: Pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010. Only participants exhibiting skin changes are included in this analysis.

class.title: No skin necrosis or missing data

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Heparin-induced Thrombocytopenia (HIT II) Under UFH/LMWH Therapy
outcome.description: HIT II is characterized as a sudden decrease of thrombocyte count because of allergic response on heparin/platelet factor 4 (PF-4) complexes and is a severe and potentially fatal side effect of heparins. Usually, HIT occurs between Day 5 and Day 14 of exposure to UFH or LMWH.
outcome.population: Pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010

group.title: Fondaparinux
group.description: Retrospective systematic documentation of female patients treated with Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum. Higher than recommended doses could have been administered off label.

measure.description: HIT II is characterized as a sudden decrease of thrombocyte count because of allergic response on heparin/platelet factor 4 (PF-4) complexes and is a severe and potentially fatal side effect of heparins. Usually, HIT occurs between Day 5 and Day 14 of exposure to UFH or LMWH.
measure.population: Pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Heparin-induced Thrombocytopenia (HIT II) Under Fondaparinux Therapy
outcome.description: The participant with HIT II was pretreated with LMWH; however, the serious adverse event of HIT II was documented after the participant switched to Fondaparinux treatment.
outcome.population: Pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010

group.title: Fondaparinux
group.description: Retrospective systematic documentation of female patients treated with Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum. The potential prophylactic dose was 1.5 or 2.5 milligrams (mg); the standard prophylactic dose was 2.5 mg. The potential therapeutic dose was 5, 7.5, or 10 mg. Higher than recommended doses could have been administered off label.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Heparin-induced Thrombocytopenia (HIT II) Under Fondaparinux Therapy
measure.description: The participant with HIT II was pretreated with LMWH; however, the serious adverse event of HIT II was documented after the participant switched to Fondaparinux treatment.
measure.population: Pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010

class.title: No HIT II or missing data

outcome.title: Duration From Start of Fondaparinux Therapy to HIT
outcome.description: For the 1 participant who developed HIT after receiving Fondaparinux, the number of days from start of therapy to HIT is presented.
outcome.population: Pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010. Only one participant developed HIT after receiving Fondaparinux; thus, rather than presenting median data, data are presented as the number of days from start of therapy to HIT.

group.title: Fondaparinux
group.description: Retrospective systematic documentation of female patients treated with Fondaparinux during pregnancy and/or postpartum. The potential prophylactic dose was 1.5 or 2.5 milligrams (mg); the standard prophylactic dose was 2.5 mg. The potential therapeutic dose was 5, 7.5, or 10 mg. Higher than recommended doses could have been administered off label.

measure.title: Duration From Start of Fondaparinux Therapy to HIT
measure.description: For the 1 participant who developed HIT after receiving Fondaparinux, the number of days from start of therapy to HIT is presented.
measure.population: Pregnant women who received prophylaxis because of an elevated thromboembolic risk or therapeutic treatment of acute thromboembolism between the years of 2004 and 2010. Only one participant developed HIT after receiving Fondaparinux; thus, rather than presenting median data, data are presented as the number of days from start of therapy to HIT.

group.title: Fondaparinux - Mother
group.description: Events reported for mothers receiving Fondaparinux

group.title: Fondaparinux - Child
group.description: Events reported for children (including 4 twins) born to mothers receiving Fondaparinux

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
